content:
https://github.com/rust-lang/reference/pull/1168 was approved and merged on tuesday and 1.59 shipped with inline assembly on thursday.
The release notes of 1.59 point to the nightly reference for limitations, but the supported directives list isn't in the published nightly reference (https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/reference/inline-assembly.html). Would it be possible to get this updated soon?

I believe @Josh Triplett was going to take care of it, I believe @Eric Huss has a script to do this and typically we update ~once per release cycle.

(It should be relatively easy to just bump the submodule in rust-lang/rust, though, if we do it without the script).
I update the books every other week. It should be synced this Monday or Tuesday, and show up in the nightly docs later in the week as it makes its way through the queue and into a release.
Heh, well, I guess I thought it was rarer -- time really does fly.
@simulacrum Sorry for the mixup. Originally there was some suggestion of making sure it was in the release, but someone said it'd be fine if it was just in nightly, so I didn't.
